intro: Rosa gallica var. flaccida, commonly known as the French rose or the white gallica rose, is a shrub-like plant native to Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its fragrant, semi-double to double pink or white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has thorny stems and dark green, serrated leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Its historical use in perfumery and as a symbol of love and devotion adds to its cultural significance.
